data.name: Shin Megami Tensei III Nocturne HD Remaster - Chronicle Pack
data.detailed_description:
Raidou Kuzunoha sets foot into the Vortex World! Play the previously unreleased Chronicle Edition for the first time! Select “NEW GAME: CHRONICLE” and enjoy the exciting new Amala Labyrinth and intense battles against the Fiends in this new story branch featuring Raidou Kuzunoha.

*You can only select this mode when starting a new game.
*Not compatible with the save data from the original “NEW GAME.
data.about_the_game:
Raidou Kuzunoha sets foot into the Vortex World! Play the previously unreleased Chronicle Edition for the first time! Select “NEW GAME: CHRONICLE” and enjoy the exciting new Amala Labyrinth and intense battles against the Fiends in this new story branch featuring Raidou Kuzunoha.

*You can only select this mode when starting a new game.
*Not compatible with the save data from the original “NEW GAME.
data.short_description: Raidou Kuzunoha sets foot into the Vortex World!

fullgame.name: Shin Megami Tensei III Nocturne HD Remaster

data.supported_languages:
English*, Japanese*, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Traditional Chinese
*languages with full audio support

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 8.1
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo E8400 or AMD Phenom II X2 545
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTS 450, 1 GB or AMD Radeon HD 5750, 1 GB or Intel HD Graphics 530
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 14 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: DLC Disk Space: 1.02 GB
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-550 or AMD Phenom II X2 560
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTS 450, 1 GB or AMD Radeon HD 5770, 1 GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 14 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: DLC Disk Space: 1.02 GB

content_descriptors.notes: Acts of violence, including killing, are depicted, though the use of blood and gore is minimal. Some character designs are provocative. Dialogue uses expletives from time to time.
